text: William Clarke (6 February 1948 - 2 February 2014), better known by his stage names Bunny Rugs and Bunny Scott, was a Jamaican reggae musician. He was best known as a member of the band reggae band Third World. == Early life and career == He was born on 6 February 1948 in Mandeville. He was raised in the capital city, Kingston. He began his career in the mid-1960s. He was also at one time a member of the and Inner Circle and half of the duo Bunny & Ricky. == Death == Clarke died from leukaemia on 2 February 2014 at an intensive care facility in Orlando, Florida in the United States. He was 65. He was outlived by his wife and eight children. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:2014 deaths Category:Jamaican singers Category:Jamaican reggae musicians Category:Deaths from leukemia Category:Cancer deaths in Florida
title: Bunny Rugs
